wikipedia_page.main:
Bradbury Norton (23 August 1834 – 21 February 1917) was an English lawyer and amateur cricketer.
Norton was born at Town Malling in Kent. He played in ten first-class cricket matches for Kent County Cricket Club between his debut in 1858 and his final match for the side in 1866. Norton's brother, William South Norton, was captain of the Kent team at the time and honorary secretary of the county club formed at Maidstone in 1859. As well as playing for Kent, Norton also made appearances for the Gentlemen of Kent between 1860 and 1869. Another brother, Selby Norton, made a single first-class appearance for Kent as an emergency replacement in 1863 and a cousin, William Norton, played three times for the county side.Professionally Norton was a lawyer working in Kent. He died in 1917 at Taltal in Chile aged 82.

response: Another brother, Bradbury Norton, and a nephew, Henry Hayman, also played first-class cricket.

Hayman married Ellen Cobham Brewer, daughter of the scientist Ebenezer Cobham Brewer who lived with the family whilst they were at Edwinstowe. They had three children, Charles Telford, Percival and Phyllis. Charles attended St John's College, Cambridge and was headmaster at Winchester House Preparatory School in Brackley in Northamptonshire.Hayman, Charles Henry Telford in Venn J (ed) Op. cit., p.301. Retrieved 2017-10-27. His uncles Bradbury Norton, William South Norton and Selby Norton all played first-class cricket.

Norton was born at Aylesford in Kent in 1820 and was a nephew of Alfred Mynn, a signficiant figure in Kent cricket during the 1840s. Two cousins, Bradbury Norton and William South Norton, also played for Kent, the later captaining the side between 1856 and 1870. He died in Lambeth in 1873 aged 53.
